name: Hanoi
description: Vietnam's bustling capital, known for its rich history, French colonial architecture, vibrant street life, and delicious cuisine.

name: Ho Chi Minh City (Saigon)
description: A dynamic metropolis with a mix of modern skyscrapers, historical landmarks, and a lively atmosphere.

name: Hoi An
description: A UNESCO World Heritage city with charming ancient streets, well-preserved architecture, and a laid-back atmosphere.

name: Da Nang
description: A modern coastal city with beautiful beaches, stunning natural landscapes like the Marble Mountains, and a growing culinary scene.

name: Hue
description: The former imperial capital of Vietnam, steeped in history with a majestic citadel, tombs of past emperors, and the serene Perfume River.

name: Nha Trang
description: A popular beach resort town with pristine beaches, vibrant nightlife, and island hopping opportunities.

name: Sapa
description: A mountain town in northern Vietnam known for its cascading rice terraces, cool climate, trekking routes, and encounters with hill tribe communities.

name: Da Lat
description: Known as the 'City of Eternal Spring' for its cool climate, pine forests, waterfalls, and French colonial villas.

name: Phu Quoc
description: The largest island in Vietnam with breathtaking beaches, lush national park, and opportunities for snorkeling and diving.

name: Can Tho
description: The largest city in the Mekong Delta, known for its floating markets, lush river landscapes, and local life along the waterways.

name: Ha Long Bay
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site famous for its thousands of limestone karst islands rising from emerald waters.

name: Ninh Binh
description: Called 'Ha Long Bay on land' for its scenic limestone karsts and rice paddies. Explore by boat through caves and ancient temples.

name: Mui Ne
description: A coastal town popular for water sports like kitesurfing and windsurfing, boasting unique sand dunes.

name: Phong Nha-Ke Bang National Park
description: Home to the world's largest cave, Son Doong, and a network of spectacular cave systems and underground rivers.

name: Con Dao
description: An archipelago with pristine beaches, historical sites of former prisons, and protected natural areas for hiking and diving.

name: Ha Giang
description: A mountainous province in far-north Vietnam with majestic landscapes, winding roads, and ethnic minority villages.

name: Quy Nhon
description: A coastal city with long stretches of beaches, historical Cham sites, and less crowded than more popular destinations.

name: Buon Ma Thuot
description: The coffee capital of Vietnam, located in the Central Highlands with options to visit coffee plantations and waterfalls.

name: My Tho
description: A Mekong Delta town known for boat trips through canals, tropical fruit orchards, and insights into local life.

name: Chau Doc
description: Mekong Delta town on the Cambodian border, known for its floating markets, diverse religious communities (including Cham Muslims), and Sam Mountain with its temples and views.
